item.title: Config Params
item.description:
Config Params

You can use the following param parameters to configure the theme in your site config.

title_sep

The title's seperator to use. Default is " â€“ ".

search

Search configuration options:

  • enable(bool): Toggles search. Defaults to true
  • default_enable(bool): Default search status. This is useful to turn this off and manually turn on in the frontmadder of the pages you want. Defaults to true
  • format(string): One of the search formats. Defaults to pagefind

item.title: Frontmadder Params
item.description:
Frontmadder Params

You can use the following param parameters to configure your pages.

sort_by

A string that controls the sort, even for each section. Sorting is controled by sort partial.

pagesize

A string that controls the pagination size. This is useful in section where the blog templates or content type is used to control per-section pagination size.

search

bool: Toggles search for this specific page. Defaults to what it is set in the search configuration.

item.title: Menu Params
item.description:
Menu Params

You can use the following param parameters to configure your menus. These variables should be put under the params object of the menu.

attributes

Specify the custom attributes you want to add. These attributes will be placed before the href of the link element (the a tag).

example:

menus:
  main:
    - name: test
      pageRef: /
      params:
        attributes:
          class: "active"
